nodes.text: The apple looks like it was eaten by something with sharp, pointy teeth.
I can also see some blue-colored fur stuck to the core.
It may well be that the thief has passed this way several times... and that he may pass here again.
Hmmm... I see some sticky marks on the ground leading towards the Fireplace.
Drat, the sticky trail only goes a few feet. Guess the thief eats quickly.
Eh, who cares about a stupid apple core anyway?

options.text: Set a Trap near the Apple Core

nodes.text: These apple cores are obviously leading somewhere - and that this is just the start of the trail. I think I'll have more success using a trap further along.
If I put some gooey here, maybe the thief will get caught in it.
If I put down a trap, maybe I'll catch the thief.
That looks like a good hiding spot. The thief will never suspect...
No sign of the thief and it's getting late. Maybe I should try again tomorrow?
I'll take my trap back with me.
The gooey is already starting to dry up. It won't trap a fly now.
Oh, man, great idea! - if only I had a trap...
Sorry, but this is too una-peel-ing to take with me.
